Summary Microsoft Redmond WA campus - Windows Server 2012 TAP Engineering Validation, and TE 2014 - Houston, TX were last instances of formal continuing education. 
 
Current Implementations, expert areas and systems management are as follows: 
Server 2012 R2 Farm - Sr. Systems Engineer WRAR Datacenter; Virtualized Environment Switched over to Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V VMs.  
 
Also currently or recently managing and solo-implementation of: WS2012 AD/ADFS with Hybrid connect to Azure for DB replication,. AD replication, second-site disaster recovery, VM replica hold and blob storage. Additionally; SQL 2014, IIS 8, DNS, System Center, Exchange 2010/2013, Lync Server 2010/2013 for UC Voice Communications, Cisco Routing/Switching Environment. 
 
Other previous systems management have included: Exchange 5.x-2013, SQL Server through 2014, Windows Server NT 4 through WS 2012 R2, Hyper-V and ESX Virtualizations, Windows Client 3.x through 8.1, Microsoft Unified Communications Server through Lync Server 2013 for UC Voice including hybrid hosting; Cisco ASA and ASA-X, Ironport, Meraki, and Catalyst for Routing/Switching.  
I attend annual training with a study focus on systems/network security. 
Other products I have managed in production are: (Net) Juniper, Brocade, Allied Telesis and HP.  
Symantec Endpoint and Backup Exec; multiple 3rd party supporting products such as tools from Idera, GFI, Veam, Telerik, Riverbed, etc. 
 
I have managed and implemented Audio/Video commercial systems from both URC and Crestron, and have training with Honeywell Security & Access Control products.  
 
I've managed networks and systems since the dot com era, and have managed everything from dialup stacks, to systems and operations in enterprise networks and all the way to my current datacenter. 
 
I am a systems veteran who loves and adores what I do, and everything technical around me. I am a jack-of-all trades who thrives on challenging environments that have an emphasis on Teamwork.
